alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 29 at 3:00AM HST until January 29 at 6:30AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: The National Weather Service in Honolulu has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... The island of Maui in Maui County * Until 630 AM HST. * At 300 AM HST, the Maui Emergency Management Agency reported that Makawao Avenue and South Kihei Road were still closed due to flooding. Although the size of heavy rain has diminished, there were still areas with rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour near Keanae, Haiku, and Kaanapali. Runoff levels will remain elevated for several more hours. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. * This warning includes the entire island of Maui. This warning may need to be extended beyond 630 AM HST if flooding persists. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
